DrugTracker.qrcodes module¶

DrugTracker.qrcodes.createQR(url)¶

This function can turn a url into a QRCode image.

Funciton makes it possible to produce a QRCode for our unique dose url’s associated with each dose a patient is going to take.

Parameters

url (string) – url is a string of what our qr code should point to e.g. http://127.0.0.1:8000/dose/1z5Lff10AN

Returns

Currently the function is only printing the qr code to the terminal and not saving them as images.

Return type

print

DrugTracker.tests module¶

DrugTracker.urls module¶

DrugTracker.views module¶

DrugTracker.views.getMedicationName(medicationCode)¶

This function is used to get the name of a medication using its unique medication code.

This function is the link between the unique key for a medication (its code) and how to get its name from that.

Parameters

request (request) – Request is built in to django and stores the current state of the system e.g. the username of the logged in user.

Returns

Will return a string of the name of the medication with that code or a blank screen if there is no medication with that code.

Return type

string

DrugTracker.views.home(request)¶

This function is run when the user has logged in and gets brought to http://127.0.0.1:8000/home

This function will display home.html in the user’s web browser. It will pass in a list of perscriptions which the user needs to take today into home.html

Parameters

request (request) – Request is built in to django and stores the current state of the system e.g. the username of the logged in user.

Returns

Will render the home.html file with the list of the user’s perscriptions that need to be taken today.

Return type

render

DrugTracker.views.index(request)¶

This function is run when the user opens the site at http://127.0.0.1:8000

This function will display login.html in the user’s web browser.

Parameters

request (request) – Request is built in to django and stores the current state of the system e.g. the username of the logged in user.

Returns

Will render the login.html file.

Return type

render

DrugTracker.views.takeDose(request, doseURL)¶

This function is called when the user navigates to http://127.0.0.1:8000/dose/<somenumber>

Our QRCodes will open up to unique dose sites, e.g. http://127.0.0.1:8000/dose/1z5Lff10AN When these links are opened this function will be called. We can then check that the logged in user owns the dose associated with this dose URL and later on implement the record video feature at this page.

Parameters

  • request (request) – Request is built in to django and stores the current state of the system e.g. the username of the logged in user.

  • doseURL (string) – doseURL is a string of what comes after /dose/ in the url opened. For example if the user opened

  • http – //127.0.0.1:8000/dose/1z5Lff10AN then doseURL would be equal to 1z5Lff10AN when this function is called.

Returns

Currently the function is only returning some Text showing the doseURL the function has been called with.

Return type

render
